uia.sim

Class Env

  • java.lang.Object
    • uia.sim.Env
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RealtimeEnv

    public class Env
extends java.lang.Object
    The simulation environment.

    The simplest example: 

    
 final Env env = new Env();
 env.process("Hello", y -> {
     y.call(env.timeout("10"));
     System.out.println(env.getNow() + ", Hello DESimJava");
 }); 
 env.run();
    Above example will output: 
     10, Hello DESimJava
    Author:
    Kan

      • process

        public Process process(java.lang.String id,
                       java.util.function.Consumer<Yield2Way<Event,java.lang.Object>> taskRunner)
        Creates a new process event.

        The process will pass a yield object to the taskRunner. When taskRunner invokes yeild.call(anotherEvent), the yield object will notify the process to attach method:resume to the callables of the anotherEvent.

        When the environment steps to the anotherEvent, the method:resume of callable will be invoked.

        Note: anotherEvent must be scheduled into the environment, otherwise callables will never be invoked.

        Parameters:
        id - The process id.
        taskRunner - A runner of the process tasks.
        Returns:
        A new process event.
